subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
Nominalisation of {{och-l|設|tr=*ŋ̊et|to set up}}, i.e. “that which is set up” ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}; {{zh-ref|Baxter and Sagart, 2014}}). Compare the following quote from ''{{w|Han Feizi}}'':

: {{zh-x|吾 所 為{wéi} 言 '''勢''' 者，言 人 之 所 '''設''' 也。|The '''setup''' (''*ŋ̊et-s'') of which I am speaking refers to what is '''set up''' (''*ŋ̊et'') by men.|ref=Hanfeizi|collapsed=y}}
